name: Microbiology Chapter 21 Textbook Questions
description: Multiple choice questions from the textbook for Chapter 21 of Microbiology.
subject: Microbiology

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Which of the following is not a skin infection?
questions.explanation: Tinea corporis is a fungal infection, not a bacterial skin infection like the others.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Which of the following is a type of ringworm?
questions.explanation: Tinea barbae, tinea capitis, and tinea cruris are all types of ringworm affecting different parts of the body.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Which of the following is inflammation of the conjunctiva?
questions.explanation: Conjunctivitis is the medical term for inflammation of the conjunctiva, also known as pinkeye.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Which of the following is a major cause of preventable blindness that can be reduced with regular handwashing?
questions.explanation: Ocular trachoma, caused by Chlamydia trachomatis, is a leading cause of preventable blindness and is often spread through poor hygiene.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Which of the following is not a cause of neonatal conjunctivitis?
questions.explanation: Candida albicans is a fungus and is not a typical cause of neonatal conjunctivitis, which is usually bacterial.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: A wound that produces pus is called ________.
questions.explanation: A purulent wound is one that is discharging pus.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Which of the following is a common bacterium that can cause skin infections?
questions.explanation: All of the listed bacteria are common causes of skin infections.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: A deep lesion that develops from multiple boils is called a ________.
questions.explanation: A carbuncle is a cluster of boils that form a connected area of infection under the skin.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: ________ is a bacterial infection of the skin that is characterized by a reddish rash with a distinct border.
questions.explanation: Erysipelas is a specific type of cellulitis that presents with a well-demarcated, raised, and erythematous rash.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: The ________ is the transparent outer layer of the eye.
questions.explanation: The cornea is the transparent front part of the eye that covers the iris, pupil, and anterior chamber.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: The parasitic worm Loa loa can cause what disease?
questions.explanation: Loa loa is the causative agent of loiasis, also known as African eye worm.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.question: Which of the following is a fungal infection of the nails?
questions.explanation: Tinea unguium, also known as onychomycosis, is a fungal infection of the nails.
